intro: Astronidium carolinense, commonly known as the Carolina starling tree, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet. Its leaves are opposite, oval-shaped, and have a smooth texture. The fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that contains a single seed, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
